p: Isoacteoside was the most dominant compound found in EEPS. Isoacteoside is a dihydroxypheynylethyl glycoside, which was also reported to exhibit multiple biological activities. Isoacteoside isolated from Abeliophyllum distichum was evidenced to have anti-inflammatory activity, by suppressing the production and expression of proinflammatory cytokines [ 45]. In addition, isoacteoside had the capacity to decrease amyloid- β deposition and cytotoxicity by preventing amyloid- β aggregation, suggesting its therapeutic potential for Alzheimer's diseases [ 46].
